author: Hilary Potkewitz
title: The Smart Way to Pack for Several Months in Outer Space - WSJ
text:
Life The Smart Way to Pack for Several Months in Outer Space Astronaut Sunita Williams preps for a trip to the international space station; no potato chips allowed, but Marshmallow Fluff is a must By Feb. 27, 2017 5:02 p.m. ET 
Sunita Williamsâ€™s commute is more harrowing than yours. 
The Houston resident used to take a shuttle from Cape Canaveral, Fla., but that stopped running in 2011. Since then, she and her colleagues have been making a connecting flight through Baikonur, Kazakhstan, and boarding a Russian Soyuz craft for the final leg of their trip to the international space station. The flight can be as short as six hours, but reaches speeds of about... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
